      • TcpServer

        public TcpServer​(int port,
                 int timeout)
        Parameters:
        port - port number that the server is to connect to
        timeout - how many milliseconds of zero activity until a client is automatically disconnected

      • TcpServer

        public TcpServer​(int port,
                 int timeout,
                 int backLog)
        Parameters:
        port - port number that the server is to connect to
        timeout - how many milliseconds of zero activity until a client is automatically disconnected
        backLog - how many connections are allowed

      • TcpServer

        public TcpServer​(int port,
                 int timeout,
                 int backLog,
                 java.net.InetAddress bindAddr)
        Parameters:
        port - port number that the server is to connect to
        timeout - how many milliseconds of zero activity until a client is automatically disconnected
        backLog - how many connections are allowed
        bindAddr - the local InetAddress the server will bind to. Leave null if you want to use "localhost"

      • TcpServer

        public TcpServer​(int port,
                 int timeout,
                 int backLog,
                 boolean startImmediately)
          throws ServerException
        Parameters:
        port - port number that the server is to connect to
        timeout - how many milliseconds of zero activity until a client is automatically disconnected
        backLog - how many connections are allowed
        startImmediately - should the server immediately connect and start
        Throws:
        ServerException

      • TcpServer

        public TcpServer​(int port,
                 int timeout,
                 int backLog,
                 java.net.InetAddress bindAddr,
                 boolean startImmediately)
          throws ServerException
        Parameters:
        port - port number that the server is to connect to
        timeout - how many milliseconds of zero activity until a client is automatically disconnected
        backLog - how many connections are allowed
        startImmediately - should the server immediately connect and start
        bindAddr - the local InetAddress the server will bind to. Leave null if you want to use "localhost"
        Throws:
        ServerException

        Returns:
